00397 static inline uint64_t CVMX_UCTLX_UPHY_PORTX_CTL_STATUS(unsigned long offset, unsigned long block_id)
00398 {
00399     if (!(
00400           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN61XX) && (((offset <= 1)) && ((block_id == 0)))) ||
00401           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX) && (((offset <= 1)) && ((block_id == 0)))) ||
00402           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) && (((offset <= 1)) && ((block_id == 0)))) ||
00403           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) && (((offset <= 1)) && ((block_id == 0)))) ||
00404           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF71XX) && (((offset <= 1)) && ((block_id == 0))))))
00405         cvmx_warn("CVMX_UCTLX_UPHY_PORTX_CTL_STATUS(%lu,%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset, block_id);
00406     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x000118006F000010ull) + (((offset) & 1) + ((block_id) & 0) * 0x0ull) * 8;
00407 }
00408 #else
00409 #define CVMX_UCTLX_UPHY_PORTX_CTL_STATUS(offset, block_id) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x000118006F000010ull) + (((offset) & 1) + ((block_id) & 0) * 0x0ull) * 8)
00410 #endif

00517 /**
00518  * cvmx_uctl#_clk_rst_ctl
00519  *
00520  * CLK_RST_CTL = Clock and Reset Control Reigster
00521  * This register controls the frequceny of hclk and resets for hclk and phy clocks. It also controls Simulation modes and Bists.
00522  */
00523 union cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl {
00524     uint64_t u64;
00525     struct cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl_s {
00526 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00527     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
00528     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;  /**< Clear BIST on the HCLK memories */
00529     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;  /**< Starts BIST on the HCLK memories during 0-to-1
00530                                                          transition. */
00531     uint64_t ehci_sm                      : 1;  /**< Only set it during simulation time. When set to 1,
00532                                                          this bit sets the PHY in a non-driving mode so the
00533                                                          EHCI can detect device connection.
00534                                                          Note: it must not be set to 1, during normal
00535                                                          operation. */
00536     uint64_t ohci_clkcktrst               : 1;  /**< Clear clock reset. Active low.  OHCI initial reset
00537                                                          signal for the DPLL block. This is only needed by
00538                                                          simulation. The duration of the reset  in simulation
00539                                                          must be the same as HRST.
00540                                                          Note: it must be set to 1 during normal operation. */
00541     uint64_t ohci_sm                      : 1;  /**< OHCI Simulation Mode. It selects the counter value
00542                                                           for simulation or real time for 1 ms.
00543                                                          - 0: counter full 1ms; 1: simulation time. */
00544     uint64_t ohci_susp_lgcy               : 1;  /**< OHCI Clock Control Signal. Note: This bit must be
00545                                                          set to 0 if the OHCI 48/12Mhz clocks must be
00546                                                          suspended when the EHCI and OHCI controllers are
00547                                                          not active. */
00548     uint64_t app_start_clk                : 1;  /**< OHCI Clock Control Signal. When the OHCI clocks are
00549                                                          suspended, the system has to assert this signal to
00550                                                          start the clocks (12 and 48 Mhz). */
00551     uint64_t o_clkdiv_rst                 : 1;  /**< OHCI 12Mhz  clock divider reset. Active low. When
00552                                                          set to 0, divider is held in reset.
00553                                                          The reset to the divider is also asserted when core
00554                                                          reset is asserted. */
00555     uint64_t h_clkdiv_byp                 : 1;  /**< Used to enable the bypass input to the USB_CLK_DIV */
00556     uint64_t h_clkdiv_rst                 : 1;  /**< Host clock divider reset. Active low. When set to 0,
00557                                                          divider is held in reset. This must be set to 0
00558                                                          before change H_DIV0 and H_DIV1.
00559                                                          The reset to the divider is also asserted when core
00560                                                          reset is asserted. */
00561     uint64_t h_clkdiv_en                  : 1;  /**< Hclk enable. When set to 1, the hclk is gernerated. */
00562     uint64_t o_clkdiv_en                  : 1;  /**< OHCI 48Mhz/12MHz clock enable. When set to 1, the
00563                                                          clocks are gernerated. */
00564     uint64_t h_div                        : 4;  /**< The hclk frequency is sclk frequency divided by
00565                                                          H_DIV. The maximum frequency of hclk is 200Mhz.
00566                                                          The minimum frequency of hclk is no less than the
00567                                                          UTMI clock frequency which is 60Mhz. After writing a
00568                                                          value to this field, the software should read the
00569                                                          field for the value written. The [H_ENABLE] field of
00570                                                          this register should not be set until after this
00571                                                          field is set and  then read.
00572                                                          Only the following values are valid:
00573                                                             1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12.
00574                                                          All other values are reserved and will be coded as
00575                                                          following:
00576                                                             0        -> 1
00577                                                             5        -> 4
00578                                                             7        -> 6
00579                                                             9,10,11  -> 8
00580                                                             13,14,15 -> 12 */
00581     uint64_t p_refclk_sel                 : 2;  /**< PHY PLL Reference Clock Select.
00582                                                          - 00: uses 12Mhz crystal at USB_XO and USB_XI;
00583                                                          - 01: uses 12/24/48Mhz 2.5V clock source at USB_XO.
00584                                                              USB_XI should be tied to GND(Not Supported).
00585                                                          1x: Reserved. */
00586     uint64_t p_refclk_div                 : 2;  /**< PHY Reference Clock Frequency Select.
00587                                                            - 00: 12MHz,
00588                                                            - 01: 24Mhz (Not Supported),
00589                                                            - 10: 48Mhz (Not Supported),
00590                                                            - 11: Reserved.
00591                                                          Note: This value must be set during POR is active.
00592                                                          If a crystal is used as a reference clock,this field
00593                                                          must be set to 12 MHz. Values 01 and 10 are reserved
00594                                                          when a crystal is used. */
00595     uint64_t reserved_4_4                 : 1;
00596     uint64_t p_com_on                     : 1;  /**< PHY Common Block Power-Down Control.
00597                                                          - 1: The XO, Bias, and PLL blocks are powered down in
00598                                                              Suspend mode.
00599                                                          - 0: The XO, Bias, and PLL blocks remain powered in
00600                                                              suspend mode.
00601                                                           Note: This bit must be set to 0 during POR is active
00602                                                           in current design. */
00603     uint64_t p_por                        : 1;  /**< Power on reset for PHY. Resets all the PHY's
00604                                                          registers and state machines. */
00605     uint64_t p_prst                       : 1;  /**< PHY Clock Reset. The is the value for phy_rst_n,
00606                                                          utmi_rst_n[1] and utmi_rst_n[0]. It is synchronized
00607                                                          to each clock domain to generate the corresponding
00608                                                          reset signal. This should not be set to 1 until the
00609                                                          time it takes for six clock cycles (HCLK and
00610                                                          PHY CLK, which ever is slower) has passed. */
00611     uint64_t hrst                         : 1;  /**< Host Clock Reset. This is the value for hreset_n.
00612                                                          This should not be set to 1 until 12ms after PHY CLK
00613                                                          is stable. */
00614 #else
00615     uint64_t hrst                         : 1;
00616     uint64_t p_prst                       : 1;
00617     uint64_t p_por                        : 1;
00618     uint64_t p_com_on                     : 1;
00619     uint64_t reserved_4_4                 : 1;
00620     uint64_t p_refclk_div                 : 2;
00621     uint64_t p_refclk_sel                 : 2;
00622     uint64_t h_div                        : 4;
00623     uint64_t o_clkdiv_en                  : 1;
00624     uint64_t h_clkdiv_en                  : 1;
00625     uint64_t h_clkdiv_rst                 : 1;
00626     uint64_t h_clkdiv_byp                 : 1;
00627     uint64_t o_clkdiv_rst                 : 1;
00628     uint64_t app_start_clk                : 1;
00629     uint64_t ohci_susp_lgcy               : 1;
00630     uint64_t ohci_sm                      : 1;
00631     uint64_t ohci_clkcktrst               : 1;
00632     uint64_t ehci_sm                      : 1;
00633     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;
00634     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;
00635     uint64_t reserved_25_63               : 39;
00636 #endif
00637     } s;
00638     struct cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl_s       cn61xx;
00639     struct cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl_s       cn63xx;
00640     struct cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl_s       cn63xxp1;
00641     struct cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl_s       cn66xx;
00642     struct cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl_s       cn68xx;
00643     struct cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl_s       cn68xxp1;
00644     struct cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl_s       cnf71xx;
00645 };
00646 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl cvmx_uctlx_clk_rst_ctl_t;
00647 
00648 /**
00649  * cvmx_uctl#_ctl
00650  *
00651  * This register controls clocks, resets, power, and BIST.
00652  *
00653  * This register can be reset by IOI reset.
00654  */
00655 union cvmx_uctlx_ctl {
00656     uint64_t u64;
00657     struct cvmx_uctlx_ctl_s {
00658 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00659     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;  /**< BIST fast-clear mode select. A BIST run with this bit set clears all entries in USBH RAMs
00660                                                          to 0x0.
00661                                                          There are two major modes of BIST: full and clear. Full BIST is run by the BIST state
00662                                                          machine when CLEAR_BIST is deasserted during BIST. Clear BIST is run if CLEAR_BIST is
00663                                                          asserted during BIST.
00664                                                          To avoid race conditions, software must first perform a CSR write operation that puts the
00665                                                          CLEAR_BIST setting into the correct state and then perform another CSR write operation to
00666                                                          set the BIST trigger (keeping the CLEAR_BIST state constant).
00667                                                          CLEAR BIST completion is indicated by UCTL()_BIST_STATUS. A BIST clear operation
00668                                                          takes almost 2,000 controller-clock cycles for the largest RAM. */
00669     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;  /**< Rising edge starts BIST on the memories in USBH.
00670                                                          To run BIST, the controller clock must be both configured and enabled, and should be
00671                                                          configured to the maximum available frequency given the available coprocessor clock and
00672                                                          dividers.
00673                                                          Also, the UCTL, UAHC, and UPHY should be held in software- initiated reset (using
00674                                                          UPHY_RST, UAHC_RST, UCTL_RST) until BIST is complete.
00675                                                          BIST defect status can be checked after FULL BIST completion, both of which are indicated
00676                                                          in UCTL()_BIST_STATUS. The full BIST run takes almost 80,000 controller-clock cycles for
00677                                                          the largest RAM. */
00678     uint64_t ref_clk_sel                  : 2;  /**< Reference clock select. Choose reference-clock source for the SuperSpeed and high-speed
00679                                                          PLL blocks.
00680                                                          0x0 = Reference clock source for both PLLs come from the USB pads.
00681                                                          0x1 = Reserved.
00682                                                          0x2 = Reserved.
00683                                                          0x3 = Reserved.
00684                                                          This value can be changed only during UPHY_RST.
00685                                                          If REF_CLK_SEL = 0x0, then the reference clock input cannot be spread-spectrum. */
00686     uint64_t ssc_en                       : 1;  /**< Spread-spectrum clock enable. Enables spread-spectrum clock production in the SuperSpeed
00687                                                          function. If the input reference clock for the SuperSpeed PLL is already spread-spectrum,
00688                                                          then do not enable this feature. The clocks sourced to the SuperSpeed function must have
00689                                                          spread-spectrum to be compliant with the USB specification.
00690                                                          The high-speed PLL cannot support a spread-spectrum input, so REF_CLK_SEL = 0x0 must
00691                                                          enable this feature.
00692                                                          This value may only be changed during [UPHY_RST]. */
00693     uint64_t ssc_range                    : 3;  /**< Spread-spectrum clock range. Selects the range of spread-spectrum modulation when SSC_EN
00694                                                          is asserted and the PHY is spreading the SuperSpeed transmit clocks.
00695                                                          Applies a fixed offset to the phase accumulator.
00696                                                          0x0 = -4980 ppm downspread of clock.
00697                                                          0x1 = -4492 ppm.
00698                                                          0x2 = -4003 ppm.
00699                                                          0x3-0x7 = reserved.
00700                                                          All of these settings are within the USB 3.0 specification. The amount of EMI emission
00701                                                          reduction might decrease as the [SSC_RANGE] increases; therefore, the [SSC_RANGE] settings
00702                                                          can
00703                                                          be registered to enable the amount of spreading to be adjusted on a per-application basis.
00704                                                          This value can be changed only during UPHY_RST. */
00705     uint64_t ssc_ref_clk_sel              : 9;  /**< Enables non-standard oscillator frequencies to generate targeted MPLL output rates. Input
00706                                                          corresponds to the frequency-synthesis coefficient.
00707                                                          [55:53]: modulus - 1,
00708                                                          [52:47]: 2's complement push amount
00709                                                          Must leave at reset value of 0x0.
00710                                                          This value may only be changed during [UPHY_RST]. */
00711     uint64_t mpll_multiplier              : 7;  /**< Multiplies the reference clock to a frequency suitable for intended operating speed. Must
00712                                                          leave at reset value of 0x0. This value may only be changed during UPHY_RST.
00713                                                          This value is superseded by the REF_CLK_FSEL<5:3> selection. */
00714     uint64_t ref_ssp_en                   : 1;  /**< Enables reference clock to the prescaler for SuperSpeed function. This should always be
00715                                                          enabled since this output clock is used to drive the UAHC suspend-mode clock during
00716                                                          low-power states.
00717                                                          This value can be changed only during UPHY_RST or during low-power states.
00718                                                          The reference clock must be running and stable before UPHY_RST is deasserted and before
00719                                                          [REF_SSP_EN] is asserted. */
00720     uint64_t ref_clk_div2                 : 1;  /**< Divides the reference clock by 2 before feeding it into the REF_CLK_FSEL divider. Must
00721                                                          leave at reset value of 0x0.
00722                                                          This value can be changed only during UPHY_RST. */
00723     uint64_t ref_clk_fsel                 : 6;  /**< Selects the reference clock frequency for the SuperSpeed and high-speed PLL blocks. The
00724                                                          legal values are as follows:
00725                                                          0x27 = External reference clock 100 MHz.
00726                                                          All other values are reserved.
00727                                                          This value may only be changed during [UPHY_RST]. */
00728     uint64_t reserved_31_31               : 1;
00729     uint64_t h_clk_en                     : 1;  /**< Controller-clock enable. When set to 1, the controller clock is generated. This also
00730                                                          enables access to UCTL registers 0x30-0xF8. */
00731     uint64_t h_clk_byp_sel                : 1;  /**< Select the bypass input to the controller-clock divider.
00732                                                          0 = Use the divided coprocessor clock from the H_CLKDIV divider.
00733                                                          1 = Use the bypass clock from the GPIO pins.
00734                                                          This signal is just a multiplexer-select signal; it does not enable the controller clock.
00735                                                          You must still set H_CLK_EN separately. H_CLK_BYP_SEL select should not be changed
00736                                                          unless H_CLK_EN is disabled.
00737                                                          The bypass clock can be selected and running even if the controller-clock dividers are not
00738                                                          running. */
00739     uint64_t h_clkdiv_rst                 : 1;  /**< Controller clock divider reset. Divided clocks are not generated while the divider is
00740                                                          being reset.
00741                                                          This also resets the suspend-clock divider. */
00742     uint64_t reserved_27_27               : 1;
00743     uint64_t h_clkdiv_sel                 : 3;  /**< Controller clock-frequency-divider select. The controller-clock frequency is the
00744                                                          coprocessor-clock frequency divided by [H_CLKDIV_SEL] and must be at or below 300 MHz.
00745                                                          The divider values are the following:
00746                                                          0x0 = divide by 1.
00747                                                          0x1 = divide by 2.
00748                                                          0x2 = divide by 4.
00749                                                          0x3 = divide by 6.
00750                                                          0x4 = divide by 8.
00751                                                          0x5 = divide by 16.
00752                                                          0x6 = divide by 24.
00753                                                          0x7 = divide by 32.
00754                                                          For USB3:
00755                                                          * The controller-clock frequency must be at or above 125 MHz for any USB3 operation.
00756                                                          * The controller-clock frequency must be at or above
00757                                                          150 MHz for full-rate USB3 operation.
00758                                                          For USB2:
00759                                                          * The controller-clock frequency must be at or above 62.5 MHz for any USB2 operation.
00760                                                          * The controller-clock frequency must be at or above
00761                                                          90 MHz for full-rate USB2 operation.
00762                                                          This field can be changed only when H_CLKDIV_RST = 1. */
00763     uint64_t reserved_22_23               : 2;
00764     uint64_t usb3_port_perm_attach        : 1;  /**< Indicates this port is permanently attached. This is a strap signal; it should be modified
00765                                                          only when [UPHY_RST] is asserted. */
00766     uint64_t usb2_port_perm_attach        : 1;  /**< Indicates this port is permanently attached. This is a strap signal; it should be modified
00767                                                          only when [UPHY_RST] is asserted. */
00768     uint64_t reserved_19_19               : 1;
00769     uint64_t usb3_port_disable            : 1;  /**< Disables the USB3 (SuperSpeed) portion of this PHY. When set to 1, this signal stops
00770                                                          reporting connect/disconnect events on the port and keeps the port in disabled state. This
00771                                                          could be used for security reasons where hardware can disable a port regardless of whether
00772                                                          xHCI driver enables a port or not.
00773                                                          UAHC()_HCSPARAMS1[MAXPORTS] is not affected by this signal.
00774                                                          This is a strap signal; it should be modified only when [UPHY_RST] is asserted. */
00775     uint64_t reserved_17_17               : 1;
00776     uint64_t usb2_port_disable            : 1;  /**< Disables USB2 (high-speed/full-speed/low-speed) portion of this PHY. When set to 1, this
00777                                                          signal stops reporting connect/disconnect events on the port and keeps the port in
00778                                                          disabled state. This could be used for security reasons where hardware can disable a port
00779                                                          regardless of whether xHCI driver enables a port or not.
00780                                                          UAHC()_HCSPARAMS1[MAXPORTS] is not affected by this signal.
00781                                                          This is a strap signal; it should only be modified when [UPHY_RST] is asserted.
00782                                                          If Port0 is required to be disabled, ensure that the utmi_clk[0] is running at the normal
00783                                                          speed. Also, all the enabled USB2.0 ports should have the same clock frequency as Port0. */
00784     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
00785     uint64_t ss_power_en                  : 1;  /**< PHY SuperSpeed block power enable.
00786                                                          This is a strap signal; it should only be modified when [UPHY_RST] is asserted. */
00787     uint64_t reserved_13_13               : 1;
00788     uint64_t hs_power_en                  : 1;  /**< PHY high-speed block power enable.
00789                                                          This is a strap signal; it should only be modified when [UPHY_RST] is asserted. */
00790     uint64_t reserved_5_11                : 7;
00791     uint64_t csclk_en                     : 1;  /**< Turns on the USB UCTL interface clock (coprocessor clock). This enables access to UAHC
00792                                                          registers via the IOI, as well as UCTL registers starting from 0x30 via the RSL bus. */
00793     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
00794     uint64_t uphy_rst                     : 1;  /**< PHY reset; resets UPHY; active-high. */
00795     uint64_t uahc_rst                     : 1;  /**< Software reset; resets UAHC; active-high. */
00796     uint64_t uctl_rst                     : 1;  /**< Software reset; resets UCTL; active-high.
00797                                                          Resets UAHC DMA and register shims. Resets UCTL RSL registers 0x30-0xF8.
00798                                                          Does not reset UCTL RSL registers 0x0-0x28.
00799                                                          UCTL RSL registers starting from 0x30 can be accessed only after the controller clock is
00800                                                          active and [UCTL_RST] is deasserted. */
00801 #else
00802     uint64_t uctl_rst                     : 1;
00803     uint64_t uahc_rst                     : 1;
00804     uint64_t uphy_rst                     : 1;
00805     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
00806     uint64_t csclk_en                     : 1;
00807     uint64_t reserved_5_11                : 7;
00808     uint64_t hs_power_en                  : 1;
00809     uint64_t reserved_13_13               : 1;
00810     uint64_t ss_power_en                  : 1;
00811     uint64_t reserved_15_15               : 1;
00812     uint64_t usb2_port_disable            : 1;
00813     uint64_t reserved_17_17               : 1;
00814     uint64_t usb3_port_disable            : 1;
00815     uint64_t reserved_19_19               : 1;
00816     uint64_t usb2_port_perm_attach        : 1;
00817     uint64_t usb3_port_perm_attach        : 1;
00818     uint64_t reserved_22_23               : 2;
00819     uint64_t h_clkdiv_sel                 : 3;
00820     uint64_t reserved_27_27               : 1;
00821     uint64_t h_clkdiv_rst                 : 1;
00822     uint64_t h_clk_byp_sel                : 1;
00823     uint64_t h_clk_en                     : 1;
00824     uint64_t reserved_31_31               : 1;
00825     uint64_t ref_clk_fsel                 : 6;
00826     uint64_t ref_clk_div2                 : 1;
00827     uint64_t ref_ssp_en                   : 1;
00828     uint64_t mpll_multiplier              : 7;
00829     uint64_t ssc_ref_clk_sel              : 9;
00830     uint64_t ssc_range                    : 3;
00831     uint64_t ssc_en                       : 1;
00832     uint64_t ref_clk_sel                  : 2;
00833     uint64_t start_bist                   : 1;
00834     uint64_t clear_bist                   : 1;
00835 #endif
00836     } s;
00837     struct cvmx_uctlx_ctl_s               cn78xx;
00838     struct cvmx_uctlx_ctl_s               cn78xxp1;
00839 };
00840 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_ctl cvmx_uctlx_ctl_t;

00842 /**
00843  * cvmx_uctl#_ecc
00844  *
00845  * This register can be used to disable ECC correction, insert ECC errors, and debug ECC
00846  * failures.
00847  * * The ECC_ERR* fields are captured when there are no outstanding ECC errors indicated in
00848  * INTSTAT and a new ECC error arrives. Prioritization for multiple events occurring on the same
00849  * cycle is indicated by the ECC_ERR_SOURCE enumeration: highest encoded value has highest
00850  * priority.
00851  * * The *ECC_*_DIS fields disable ECC correction; SBE and DBE errors are still reported. If
00852  * *ECC_*_DIS = 0x1, then no data-correction occurs.
00853  * * The *ECC_FLIP_SYND fields flip the syndrome<1:0> bits to generate single-bit/double-bit
00854  * error for testing.
00855  *
00856  * 0x0 = Normal operation.
00857  * 0x1 = SBE on bit[0].
00858  * 0x2 = SBE on bit[1].
00859  * 0x3 = DBE on bit[1:0].
00860  *
00861  * This register is accessible only when UCTL()_CTL[H_CLK_EN] = 1.
00862  *
00863  * This register can be reset by IOI reset or with UCTL()_CTL[UCTL_RST].
00864  */
00865 union cvmx_uctlx_ecc {
00866     uint64_t u64;
00867     struct cvmx_uctlx_ecc_s {
00868 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00869     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
00870     uint64_t ecc_err_source               : 4;  /**< Source of ECC error, see UCTL_ECC_ERR_SOURCE_E. */
00871     uint64_t ecc_err_syndrome             : 8;  /**< Syndrome bits of the ECC error. */
00872     uint64_t ecc_err_address              : 16; /**< RAM address of the ECC error. */
00873     uint64_t reserved_21_31               : 11;
00874     uint64_t uctl_xm_r_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;  /**< Insert ECC error for testing purposes. */
00875     uint64_t uctl_xm_r_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;  /**< Enables ECC correction on UCTL AxiMaster read-data FIFO. */
00876     uint64_t uctl_xm_w_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;  /**< Insert ECC error for testing purposes. */
00877     uint64_t uctl_xm_w_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;  /**< Enables ECC correction on UCTL AxiMaster write-data FIFO. */
00878     uint64_t reserved_9_14                : 6;
00879     uint64_t uahc_ram2_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;  /**< Insert ECC error for testing purposes. */
00880     uint64_t uahc_ram2_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;  /**< Enables ECC correction on UAHC RxFIFO RAMs (RAM2). */
00881     uint64_t uahc_ram1_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;  /**< Insert ECC error for testing purposes. */
00882     uint64_t uahc_ram1_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;  /**< Enables ECC correction on UAHC TxFIFO RAMs (RAM1). */
00883     uint64_t uahc_ram0_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;  /**< Insert ECC error for testing purposes. */
00884     uint64_t uahc_ram0_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;  /**< Enables ECC correction on UAHC Desc/Reg cache (RAM0). */
00885 #else
00886     uint64_t uahc_ram0_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;
00887     uint64_t uahc_ram0_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;
00888     uint64_t uahc_ram1_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;
00889     uint64_t uahc_ram1_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;
00890     uint64_t uahc_ram2_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;
00891     uint64_t uahc_ram2_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;
00892     uint64_t reserved_9_14                : 6;
00893     uint64_t uctl_xm_w_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;
00894     uint64_t uctl_xm_w_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;
00895     uint64_t uctl_xm_r_ecc_cor_dis        : 1;
00896     uint64_t uctl_xm_r_ecc_flip_synd      : 2;
00897     uint64_t reserved_21_31               : 11;
00898     uint64_t ecc_err_address              : 16;
00899     uint64_t ecc_err_syndrome             : 8;
00900     uint64_t ecc_err_source               : 4;
00901     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
00902 #endif
00903     } s;
00904     struct cvmx_uctlx_ecc_s               cn78xx;
00905     struct cvmx_uctlx_ecc_s               cn78xxp1;
00906 };
00907 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_ecc cvmx_uctlx_ecc_t;
00908 
00909 /**
00910  * cvmx_uctl#_ehci_ctl
00911  *
00912  * UCTL_EHCI_CTL = UCTL EHCI Control Register
00913  * This register controls the general behavior of UCTL EHCI datapath.
00914  */
00915 union cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl {
00916     uint64_t u64;
00917     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl_s {
00918 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00919     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
00920     uint64_t desc_rbm                     : 1;  /**< Descriptor Read Burst Mode on AHB bus
00921                                                          - 1: A read burst can be interruprted after 16 AHB
00922                                                              clock cycle
00923                                                          - 0: A read burst will not be interrupted until it
00924                                                              finishes or no more data available */
00925     uint64_t reg_nb                       : 1;  /**< 1: EHCI register access will not be blocked by EHCI
00926                                                           buffer/descriptor access on AHB
00927                                                          - 0: Buffer/descriptor and register access will be
00928                                                              mutually exclusive */
00929     uint64_t l2c_dc                       : 1;  /**< When set to 1, set the commit bit in the descriptor
00930                                                          store commands to L2C. */
00931     uint64_t l2c_bc                       : 1;  /**< When set to 1, set the commit bit in the buffer
00932                                                          store commands to L2C. */
00933     uint64_t l2c_0pag                     : 1;  /**< When set to 1, sets the zero-page bit in store
00934                                                          command to  L2C. */
00935     uint64_t l2c_stt                      : 1;  /**< When set to 1, use STT when store to L2C. */
00936     uint64_t l2c_buff_emod                : 2;  /**< Endian format for buffer from/to the L2C.
00937                                                          IN:       A-B-C-D-E-F-G-H
00938                                                          OUT0:  A-B-C-D-E-F-G-H
00939                                                          OUT1:  H-G-F-E-D-C-B-A
00940                                                          OUT2:  D-C-B-A-H-G-F-E
00941                                                          OUT3:  E-F-G-H-A-B-C-D */
00942     uint64_t l2c_desc_emod                : 2;  /**< Endian format for descriptor from/to the L2C.
00943                                                          IN:        A-B-C-D-E-F-G-H
00944                                                          OUT0:  A-B-C-D-E-F-G-H
00945                                                          OUT1:  H-G-F-E-D-C-B-A
00946                                                          OUT2:  D-C-B-A-H-G-F-E
00947                                                          OUT3:  E-F-G-H-A-B-C-D */
00948     uint64_t inv_reg_a2                   : 1;  /**< UAHC register address  bit<2> invert. When set to 1,
00949                                                          for a 32-bit NCB I/O register access, the address
00950                                                          offset will be flipped between 0x4 and 0x0. */
00951     uint64_t ehci_64b_addr_en             : 1;  /**< EHCI AHB Master 64-bit Addressing Enable.
00952                                                          - 1: enable ehci 64-bit addressing mode;
00953                                                          - 0: disable ehci 64-bit addressing mode.
00954                                                           When ehci 64-bit addressing mode is disabled,
00955                                                           UCTL_EHCI_CTL[L2C_ADDR_MSB] is used as the address
00956                                                           bit[39:32]. */
00957     uint64_t l2c_addr_msb                 : 8;  /**< This is the bit [39:32] of an address sent to L2C
00958                                                          for ehci whenUCTL_EHCI_CFG[EHCI_64B_ADDR_EN=0]). */
00959 #else
00960     uint64_t l2c_addr_msb                 : 8;
00961     uint64_t ehci_64b_addr_en             : 1;
00962     uint64_t inv_reg_a2                   : 1;
00963     uint64_t l2c_desc_emod                : 2;
00964     uint64_t l2c_buff_emod                : 2;
00965     uint64_t l2c_stt                      : 1;
00966     uint64_t l2c_0pag                     : 1;
00967     uint64_t l2c_bc                       : 1;
00968     uint64_t l2c_dc                       : 1;
00969     uint64_t reg_nb                       : 1;
00970     uint64_t desc_rbm                     : 1;
00971     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
00972 #endif
00973     } s;
00974     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl_s          cn61xx;
00975     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl_s          cn63xx;
00976     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl_s          cn63xxp1;
00977     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl_s          cn66xx;
00978     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl_s          cn68xx;
00979     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl_s          cn68xxp1;
00980     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl_s          cnf71xx;
00981 };
00982 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl cvmx_uctlx_ehci_ctl_t;
00983 
00984 /**
00985  * cvmx_uctl#_ehci_fla
00986  *
00987  * UCTL_EHCI_FLA = UCTL EHCI Frame Length Adjument Register
00988  * This register configures the EHCI Frame Length Adjustment.
00989  */
00990 union cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla {
00991     uint64_t u64;
00992     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla_s {
00993 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00994     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
00995     uint64_t fla                          : 6;  /**< EHCI Frame Length Adjustment. This feature
00996                                                          adjusts any offset from the clock source that drives
00997                                                          the uSOF counter.  The uSOF cycle time (number of
00998                                                          uSOF counter clock periods to generate a uSOF
00999                                                          microframe length) is equal to 59,488 plus this value.
01000                                                          The default value is 32(0x20), which gives an SOF cycle
01001                                                          time of 60,000 (each microframe has 60,000 bit times).
01002                                                          -------------------------------------------------
01003                                                           Frame Length (decimal)      FLA Value
01004                                                          -------------------------------------------------
01005                                                             59488                      0x00
01006                                                             59504                      0x01
01007                                                             59520                      0x02
01008                                                             ... ...
01009                                                             59984                      0x1F
01010                                                             60000                      0x20
01011                                                             60016                      0x21
01012                                                             ... ...
01013                                                             60496                      0x3F
01014                                                          --------------------------------------------------
01015                                                          Note: keep this value to 0x20 (decimal 32) for no
01016                                                          offset. */
01017 #else
01018     uint64_t fla                          : 6;
01019     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
01020 #endif
01021     } s;
01022     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla_s          cn61xx;
01023     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla_s          cn63xx;
01024     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla_s          cn63xxp1;
01025     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla_s          cn66xx;
01026     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla_s          cn68xx;
01027     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla_s          cn68xxp1;
01028     struct cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla_s          cnf71xx;
01029 };
01030 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla cvmx_uctlx_ehci_fla_t;

01062 /**
01063  * cvmx_uctl#_host_cfg
01064  *
01065  * This register allows configuration of various host controller (UAHC) features. Most of these
01066  * are strap signals and should be modified only while the controller is not running.
01067  *
01068  * This register is accessible only when UCTL()_CTL[H_CLK_EN] = 1.
01069  *
01070  * This register can be reset by IOI reset or with UCTL()_CTL[UCTL_RST].
01071  */
01072 union cvmx_uctlx_host_cfg {
01073     uint64_t u64;
01074     struct cvmx_uctlx_host_cfg_s {
01075 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01076     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
01077     uint64_t host_current_belt            : 12; /**< This signal indicates the minimum value of all received BELT values and the BELT that is
01078                                                          set by the Set LTV command. */
01079     uint64_t reserved_38_47               : 10;
01080     uint64_t fla                          : 6;  /**< High-speed jitter adjustment. Indicates the correction required to accommodate mac3 clock
01081                                                          and utmi clock jitter to measure 125us duration. With FLA tied to 0x0, the high-speed
01082                                                          125us micro-frame is counted for 123933ns. The value needs to be programmed in terms of
01083                                                          high-speed bit times in a 30 MHz cycle. Default value that needs to be driven is 0x20
01084                                                          (assuming 30 MHz perfect clock).
01085                                                          FLA connects to the FLADJ register defined in the xHCI spec in the PCI configuration
01086                                                          space. Each count is equal to 16 high-speed bit times. By default when this register is
01087                                                          set to 0x20, it gives 125us interval. Now, based on the clock accuracy, you can decrement
01088                                                          the count or increment the count to get the 125 us uSOF window.
01089                                                          This is a strap signal; it should only be modified when UAHC is in reset (soft-reset
01090                                                          okay). */
01091     uint64_t reserved_29_31               : 3;
01092     uint64_t bme                          : 1;  /**< Bus-master enable. This signal is used to disable the bus-mastering capability of the
01093                                                          host. Disabling this capability stalls DMA accesses. */
01094     uint64_t oci_en                       : 1;  /**< Overcurrent-indication enable. When enabled, OCI input to UAHC is taken from the GPIO
01095                                                          signals and sense-converted based on OCI_ACTIVE_HIGH_EN. The MIO GPIO multiplexer must be
01096                                                          programmed accordingly.
01097                                                          When disabled, OCI input to UAHC is forced to the correct inactive state based on
01098                                                          OCI_ACTIVE_HIGH_EN.
01099                                                          This is a strap signal; it should only be modified when UAHC is in reset (soft-reset
01100                                                          okay). */
01101     uint64_t oci_active_high_en           : 1;  /**< Overcurrent sense selection. The off-chip sense (high/low) is converted to match the
01102                                                          controller's active-high sense.
01103                                                          0 = Overcurrent indication from off-chip source is active-low.
01104                                                          1 = Overcurrent indication from off-chip source is active-high.
01105                                                          This is a strap signal; it should only be modified when UAHC is in reset (soft-reset
01106                                                          okay). */
01107     uint64_t ppc_en                       : 1;  /**< Port-power-control enable.
01108                                                          0 = UAHC()_HCCPARAMS[PPC] report port-power-control feature is unavailable.
01109                                                          1 = UAHC()_HCCPARAMS[PPC] reports port-power-control feature is available. PPC output
01110                                                          from UAHC is taken to the GPIO signals and sense-converted based on PPC_ACTIVE_HIGH_EN.
01111                                                          The MIO GPIO multiplexer must be programmed accordingly.
01112                                                          This is a strap signal; it should only be modified when either the UCTL_CTL[UAHC] or
01113                                                          UAHC_GCTL[CoreSoftReset] is asserted. */
01114     uint64_t ppc_active_high_en           : 1;  /**< Port power control sense selection. The active-high port-power-control output to off-chip
01115                                                          source is converted to match the off-chip sense.
01116                                                          0 = Port-power control to off-chip source is active-low.
01117                                                          1 = Port-power control to off-chip source is active-high.
01118                                                          This is a strap signal; it should only be modified when either the UCTL_CTL[UAHC] or
01119                                                          UAHC_GCTL[CoreSoftReset] is asserted. */
01120     uint64_t reserved_0_23                : 24;
01121 #else
01122     uint64_t reserved_0_23                : 24;
01123     uint64_t ppc_active_high_en           : 1;
01124     uint64_t ppc_en                       : 1;
01125     uint64_t oci_active_high_en           : 1;
01126     uint64_t oci_en                       : 1;
01127     uint64_t bme                          : 1;
01128     uint64_t reserved_29_31               : 3;
01129     uint64_t fla                          : 6;
01130     uint64_t reserved_38_47               : 10;
01131     uint64_t host_current_belt            : 12;
01132     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
01133 #endif
01134     } s;
01135     struct cvmx_uctlx_host_cfg_s          cn78xx;
01136     struct cvmx_uctlx_host_cfg_s          cn78xxp1;
01137 };
01138 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_host_cfg cvmx_uctlx_host_cfg_t;

01144  *
01145  * Register to enable the uctl interface clock.
01146  */
01147 union cvmx_uctlx_if_ena {

01156 #endif
01157     } s;
01158     struct cvmx_uctlx_if_ena_s            cn61xx;
01159     struct cvmx_uctlx_if_ena_s            cn63xx;

01162     struct cvmx_uctlx_if_ena_s            cn68xx;
01163     struct cvmx_uctlx_if_ena_s            cn68xxp1;
01164     struct cvmx_uctlx_if_ena_s            cnf71xx;

01214  *

01216  */

01223                                                          When the error happenes, the whole NCB system needs
01224                                                          to be reset. */

01226                                                          When the error happenes, the whole NCB system needs
01227                                                          to be reset. */
01228     uint64_t wb_pop_e                     : 1;  /**< Write Buffer FIFO Poped When Empty */
01229     uint64_t wb_psh_f                     : 1;  /**< Write Buffer FIFO Pushed When Full */
01230     uint64_t cf_psh_f                     : 1;  /**< Command FIFO Pushed When Full */
01231     uint64_t or_psh_f                     : 1;  /**< OHCI Read Buffer FIFO Pushed When Full */
01232     uint64_t er_psh_f                     : 1;  /**< EHCI Read Buffer FIFO Pushed When Full */
01233     uint64_t pp_psh_f                     : 1;  /**< PP Access FIFO  Pushed When Full */
01234 #else
01235     uint64_t pp_psh_f                     : 1;
01236     uint64_t er_psh_f                     : 1;
01237     uint64_t or_psh_f                     : 1;
01238     uint64_t cf_psh_f                     : 1;
01239     uint64_t wb_psh_f                     : 1;
01240     uint64_t wb_pop_e                     : 1;
01241     uint64_t oc_ovf_e                     : 1;
01242     uint64_t ec_ovf_e                     : 1;
01243     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01244 #endif
01245     } s;

01256 /**
01257  * cvmx_uctl#_intstat
01258  *
01259  * This register provides a summary of different bits of RSL interrupts. DBEs are detected and
01260  * SBE are corrected. For debugging output for ECC DBEs/SBEs, see UCTL()_ECC. This register can
01261  * be reset by IOI reset.
01262  */
01263 union cvmx_uctlx_intstat {
01264     uint64_t u64;
01265     struct cvmx_uctlx_intstat_s {
01266 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01267     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
01268     uint64_t xm_r_dbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected double-bit error on the UCTL AxiMaster read-data FIFO. */
01269     uint64_t xm_r_sbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected single-bit error on the UCTL AxiMaster read-data FIFO. */
01270     uint64_t xm_w_dbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected double-bit error on the UCTL AxiMaster write-data FIFO. */
01271     uint64_t xm_w_sbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected single-bit error on the UCTL AxiMaster write-data FIFO. */
01272     uint64_t reserved_22_25               : 4;
01273     uint64_t ram2_dbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected double-bit error on the UAHC RxFIFO RAMs (RAM2). */
01274     uint64_t ram2_sbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected single-bit error on the UAHC RxFIFO RAMs (RAM2). */
01275     uint64_t ram1_dbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected double-bit error on the UAHC TxFIFO RAMs (RAM1). */
01276     uint64_t ram1_sbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected single-bit error on the UAHC TxFIFO RAMs (RAM1). */
01277     uint64_t ram0_dbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected double-bit error on the UAHC Desc/Reg Cache (RAM0). */
01278     uint64_t ram0_sbe                     : 1;  /**< Detected single-bit error on the UAHC Desc/Reg Cache (RAM0). */
01279     uint64_t reserved_3_15                : 13;
01280     uint64_t xm_bad_dma                   : 1;  /**< Detected bad DMA access from UAHC to IOI. Error information is logged in
01281                                                          UCTL()_SHIM_CFG[XM_BAD_DMA_*]. Received a DMA request from UAHC that violates the
01282                                                          assumptions made by the AXI-to-IOI shim. Such scenarios include: illegal length/size
01283                                                          combinations and address out-of-bounds.
01284                                                          For more information on exact failures, see the description in
01285                                                          UCTL()_SHIM_CFG[XM_BAD_DMA_TYPE]. The hardware does not translate the request correctly
01286                                                          and results may violate IOI protocols. */
01287     uint64_t xs_ncb_oob                   : 1;  /**< Detected out-of-bound register access to UAHC over IOI. The UAHC defines 1MB of register
01288                                                          space, starting at offset 0x0. Any accesses outside of this register space cause this bit
01289                                                          to be set to 1. Error information is logged in UCTL()_SHIM_CFG[XS_NCB_OOB_*]. */
01290     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
01291 #else
01292     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
01293     uint64_t xs_ncb_oob                   : 1;
01294     uint64_t xm_bad_dma                   : 1;
01295     uint64_t reserved_3_15                : 13;
01296     uint64_t ram0_sbe                     : 1;
01297     uint64_t ram0_dbe                     : 1;
01298     uint64_t ram1_sbe                     : 1;
01299     uint64_t ram1_dbe                     : 1;
01300     uint64_t ram2_sbe                     : 1;
01301     uint64_t ram2_dbe                     : 1;
01302     uint64_t reserved_22_25               : 4;
01303     uint64_t xm_w_sbe                     : 1;
01304     uint64_t xm_w_dbe                     : 1;
01305     uint64_t xm_r_sbe                     : 1;
01306     uint64_t xm_r_dbe                     : 1;
01307     uint64_t reserved_30_63               : 34;
01308 #endif
01309     } s;
01310     struct cvmx_uctlx_intstat_s           cn78xx;
01311     struct cvmx_uctlx_intstat_s           cn78xxp1;
01312 };
01313 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_intstat cvmx_uctlx_intstat_t;

01315 /**
01316  * cvmx_uctl#_ohci_ctl
01317  *
01318  * RSL registers starting from 0x10 can be accessed only after hclk is active and hreset is deasserted.
01319  *
01320  * UCTL_OHCI_CTL = UCTL OHCI Control Register
01321  * This register controls the general behavior of UCTL OHCI datapath.
01322  */
01323 union cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl {
01324     uint64_t u64;
01325     struct cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl_s {
01326 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01327     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
01328     uint64_t reg_nb                       : 1;  /**< 1: OHCI register access will not be blocked by EHCI
01329                                                           buffer/descriptor access on AHB
01330                                                          - 0: Buffer/descriptor and register access will be
01331                                                              mutually exclusive */
01332     uint64_t l2c_dc                       : 1;  /**< When set to 1, set the commit bit in the descriptor
01333                                                          store commands to L2C. */
01334     uint64_t l2c_bc                       : 1;  /**< When set to 1, set the commit bit in the buffer
01335                                                          store commands to L2C. */
01336     uint64_t l2c_0pag                     : 1;  /**< When set to 1, sets the zero-page bit in store
01337                                                          command to  L2C. */
01338     uint64_t l2c_stt                      : 1;  /**< When set to 1, use STT when store to L2C. */
01339     uint64_t l2c_buff_emod                : 2;  /**< Endian format for buffer from/to the L2C.
01340                                                          IN:       A-B-C-D-E-F-G-H
01341                                                          OUT0:  A-B-C-D-E-F-G-H
01342                                                          OUT1:  H-G-F-E-D-C-B-A
01343                                                          OUT2:  D-C-B-A-H-G-F-E
01344                                                          OUT3:  E-F-G-H-A-B-C-D */
01345     uint64_t l2c_desc_emod                : 2;  /**< Endian format for descriptor from/to the L2C.
01346                                                          IN:        A-B-C-D-E-F-G-H
01347                                                          OUT0:  A-B-C-D-E-F-G-H
01348                                                          OUT1:  H-G-F-E-D-C-B-A
01349                                                          OUT2:  D-C-B-A-H-G-F-E
01350                                                          OUT3:  E-F-G-H-A-B-C-D */
01351     uint64_t inv_reg_a2                   : 1;  /**< UAHC register address  bit<2> invert. When set to 1,
01352                                                          for a 32-bit NCB I/O register access, the address
01353                                                          offset will be flipped between 0x4 and 0x0. */
01354     uint64_t reserved_8_8                 : 1;
01355     uint64_t l2c_addr_msb                 : 8;  /**< This is the bit [39:32] of an address sent to L2C
01356                                                          for ohci. */
01357 #else
01358     uint64_t l2c_addr_msb                 : 8;
01359     uint64_t reserved_8_8                 : 1;
01360     uint64_t inv_reg_a2                   : 1;
01361     uint64_t l2c_desc_emod                : 2;
01362     uint64_t l2c_buff_emod                : 2;
01363     uint64_t l2c_stt                      : 1;
01364     uint64_t l2c_0pag                     : 1;
01365     uint64_t l2c_bc                       : 1;
01366     uint64_t l2c_dc                       : 1;
01367     uint64_t reg_nb                       : 1;
01368     uint64_t reserved_19_63               : 45;
01369 #endif
01370     } s;
01371     struct cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl_s          cn61xx;
01372     struct cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl_s          cn63xx;
01373     struct cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl_s          cn63xxp1;
01374     struct cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl_s          cn66xx;
01375     struct cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl_s          cn68xx;
01376     struct cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl_s          cn68xxp1;
01377     struct cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl_s          cnf71xx;
01378 };
01379 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl cvmx_uctlx_ohci_ctl_t;
