01411 /**
01412  * cvmx_uctl#_port#_cfg_hs
01413  *
01414  * This register controls configuration and test controls for the high-speed port 0 PHY.
01415  *
01416  * This register is accessible only when UCTL()_CTL[H_CLK_EN] = 1.
01417  *
01418  * This register can be reset by IOI reset or UCTL()_CTL[UCTL_RST].
01419  */
01420 union cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_hs {
01421     uint64_t u64;
01422     struct cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_hs_s {
01423 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01424     uint64_t reserved_58_63               : 6;
01425     uint64_t comp_dis_tune                : 3;  /**< Disconnect threshold voltage. Adjusts the voltage level for the threshold used to detect a
01426                                                          disconnect event at the host.
01427                                                          A positive binary bit setting change results in a +1.5% incremental change in the
01428                                                          threshold voltage level, while a negative binary bit setting change results in a -1.5%
01429                                                          incremental change in the threshold voltage level. */
01430     uint64_t sq_rx_tune                   : 3;  /**< Squelch threshold adjustment. Adjusts the voltage level for the threshold used to detect
01431                                                          valid high-speed data.
01432                                                          A positive binary bit setting change results in a -5% incremental change in threshold
01433                                                          voltage level, while a negative binary bit setting change results in a +5% incremental
01434                                                          change in threshold voltage level. */
01435     uint64_t tx_fsls_tune                 : 4;  /**< Low-speed/full-speed source impedance adjustment. Adjusts the low- and full-speed single-
01436                                                          ended source impedance while driving high. This parameter control is encoded in
01437                                                          thermometer code.
01438                                                          A positive thermometer code change results in a -2.5% incremental change in source
01439                                                          impedance. A negative thermometer code change results in +2.5% incremental change in
01440                                                          source impedance. Any non-thermometer code setting (that is, 0x9) is not supported and
01441                                                          reserved. */
01442     uint64_t reserved_46_47               : 2;
01443     uint64_t tx_hs_xv_tune                : 2;  /**< Transmitter high-speed crossover adjustment. This bus adjusts the voltage at which the DP0
01444                                                          and DM0 signals cross while transmitting in high-speed mode.
01445                                                          0x0 = reserved.
01446                                                          0x1 = -15 mV.
01447                                                          0x2 = +15 mV.
01448                                                          0x3 = default setting. */
01449     uint64_t tx_preemp_amp_tune           : 2;  /**< High-speed transmitter preemphasis current control. Controls the amount of current
01450                                                          sourced to DP0 and DM0 after a J-to-K or K-to-J transition. The high-speed transmitter
01451                                                          preemphasis current is defined in terms of unit amounts. One unit amount is approximately
01452                                                          600 A and is defined as 1* preemphasis current.
01453                                                          0x0 = High-speed TX preemphasis is disabled.
01454                                                          0x1 = High-speed TX preemphasis circuit sources 1* preemphasis current.
01455                                                          0x2 = High-speed TX preemphasis circuit sources 2* preemphasis current.
01456                                                          0x3 = High-speed TX preemphasis circuit sources 3* preemphasis current.
01457                                                          If these signals are not used, set them to 0x0. */
01458     uint64_t reserved_41_41               : 1;
01459     uint64_t tx_preemp_pulse_tune         : 1;  /**< High-speed transmitter preemphasis duration control. Controls the duration for which the
01460                                                          high-speed preemphasis current is sourced onto DP0 or DM0. The high-speed transmitter
01461                                                          preemphasis duration is defined in terms of unit amounts. One unit of preemphasis duration
01462                                                          is approximately 580 ps and is defined as 1* preemphasis duration. This signal is valid
01463                                                          only if either TX_PREEMP_AMP_TUNE0[1] or TX_PREEMP_AMP_TUNE0[0] is set to 1.
01464                                                          0 = 2*, long preemphasis current duration (design default).
01465                                                          1 = 1*, short preemphasis current duration.
01466                                                          If this signal is not used, set it to 0. */
01467     uint64_t tx_res_tune                  : 2;  /**< USB source-impedance adjustment. Some applications require additional devices to be added
01468                                                          on the USB, such as a series switch, which can add significant series resistance. This bus
01469                                                          adjusts the driver source impedance to compensate for added series resistance on the USB.
01470                                                          0x0 = source impedance is decreased by approximately 1.5 ohm.
01471                                                          0x1 = design default.
01472                                                          0x2 = source impedance is decreased by approximately 2 ohm.
01473                                                          0x3 = source impedance is decreased by approximately 4 ohm.
01474                                                          Any setting other than the default can result in source-impedance variation across
01475                                                          process, voltage, and temperature conditions that does not meet USB 2.0 specification
01476                                                          limits. If this bus is not used, leave it at the default setting. */
01477     uint64_t tx_rise_tune                 : 2;  /**< High-speed transmitter rise-/fall-time adjustment. Adjusts the rise/fall times of the
01478                                                          high-speed waveform. A positive binary bit setting change results in a -4% incremental
01479                                                          change in the high-speed rise/fall time. A negative binary bit setting change results in a
01480                                                          +4% incremental change in the high-speed rise/fall time. */
01481     uint64_t tx_vref_tune                 : 4;  /**< High-speed DC voltage-level adjustment. Adjusts the high-speed DC level voltage.
01482                                                          A positive binary-bit-setting change results in a +1.25% incremental change in high-speed
01483                                                          DC voltage level, while a negative binary-bit-setting change results in a -1.25%
01484                                                          incremental change in high-speed DC voltage level.
01485                                                          The default bit setting is intended to create a HighSpeed transmit
01486                                                          DC level of approximately 400mV. */
01487     uint64_t reserved_4_31                : 28;
01488     uint64_t vatest_enable                : 2;  /**< Analog test-pin select. Enables analog test voltages to be placed on the ID0 pin.
01489                                                          0x0 = Test functionality disabled.
01490                                                          0x1 = Test functionality enabled.
01491                                                          0x2, 0x3 = Reserved, invalid settings.
01492                                                          See also the PHY databook for details on how to select which analog test voltage. */
01493     uint64_t loopback_enable              : 1;  /**< Places the high-speed PHY in loopback mode, which concurrently enables high-speed receive
01494                                                          and transmit logic. */
01495     uint64_t atereset                     : 1;  /**< Per-PHY ATE reset. When the USB core is powered up (not in suspend mode), an automatic
01496                                                          tester can use this to disable PHYCLOCK and FREECLK, then re-enable them with an aligned
01497                                                          phase.
01498                                                          0 = PHYCLOCK and FREECLK are available within a specific period after ATERESET is
01499                                                          deasserted.
01500                                                          1 = PHYCLOCK and FREECLK outputs are disabled. */
01501 #else
01502     uint64_t atereset                     : 1;
01503     uint64_t loopback_enable              : 1;
01504     uint64_t vatest_enable                : 2;
01505     uint64_t reserved_4_31                : 28;
01506     uint64_t tx_vref_tune                 : 4;
01507     uint64_t tx_rise_tune                 : 2;
01508     uint64_t tx_res_tune                  : 2;
01509     uint64_t tx_preemp_pulse_tune         : 1;
01510     uint64_t reserved_41_41               : 1;
01511     uint64_t tx_preemp_amp_tune           : 2;
01512     uint64_t tx_hs_xv_tune                : 2;
01513     uint64_t reserved_46_47               : 2;
01514     uint64_t tx_fsls_tune                 : 4;
01515     uint64_t sq_rx_tune                   : 3;
01516     uint64_t comp_dis_tune                : 3;
01517     uint64_t reserved_58_63               : 6;
01518 #endif
01519     } s;
01520     struct cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_hs_s      cn78xx;
01521     struct cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_hs_s      cn78xxp1;
01522 };
01523 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_hs cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_hs_t;
01524 
01525 /**
01526  * cvmx_uctl#_port#_cfg_ss
01527  *
01528  * This register controls configuration and test controls for the SS port 0 PHY.
01529  *
01530  * This register is accessible only when UCTL()_CTL[H_CLK_EN] = 1.
01531  *
01532  * This register can be reset by IOI reset or with UCTL()_CTL[UCTL_RST].
01533  */
01534 union cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_ss {
01535     uint64_t u64;
01536     struct cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_ss_s {
01537 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01538     uint64_t tx_vboost_lvl                : 3;  /**< TX voltage-boost level. Sets the boosted transmit launch amplitude (mVppd). The default
01539                                                          bit setting is intended to set the launch amplitude to approximately 1,008 mVppd. A
01540                                                          single, positive binary bit setting change results in a +156 mVppd change in the TX launch
01541                                                          amplitude.
01542                                                          A single, negative binary bit setting change results in a -156 mVppd change in the TX
01543                                                          launch amplitude. All settings more than one binary bit change should not be used.
01544                                                          0x3 = 0.844 V launch amplitude.
01545                                                          0x4 = 1.008 V launch amplitude.
01546                                                          0x5 = 1.156 V launch amplitude.
01547                                                          All others values are invalid. */
01548     uint64_t los_bias                     : 3;  /**< Loss-of-signal detector threshold-level control. A positive, binary bit setting change
01549                                                          results in a +15 mVp incremental change in the LOS threshold.
01550                                                          A negative binary bit setting change results in a -15 mVp incremental change in the LOS
01551                                                          threshold. The 0x0 setting is reserved and must not be used. The default 0x5 setting
01552                                                          corresponds to approximately 105 mVp.
01553                                                          0x0 = invalid.
01554                                                          0x1 = 45 mV.
01555                                                          0x2 = 60 mV.
01556                                                          0x3 = 75 mV.
01557                                                          0x4 = 90 mV.
01558                                                          0x5 = 105 mV (default).
01559                                                          0x6 = 120 mV.
01560                                                          0x7 = 135 mV. */
01561     uint64_t lane0_ext_pclk_req           : 1;  /**< When asserted, this signal enables the pipe0_pclk output regardless of power state (along
01562                                                          with the associated increase in power consumption). You can use this input to enable
01563                                                          pipe0_pclk in the P3 state without going through a complete boot sequence. */
01564     uint64_t lane0_tx2rx_loopbk           : 1;  /**< When asserted, data from TX predriver is looped back to RX slicers. LOS is bypassed and
01565                                                          based on the tx0_en input so that rx0_los = !tx_data_en. */
01566     uint64_t reserved_42_55               : 14;
01567     uint64_t pcs_rx_los_mask_val          : 10; /**< Configurable loss-of-signal mask width. Sets the number of reference clock cycles to mask
01568                                                          the incoming LFPS in U3 and U2 states. Masks the incoming LFPS for the number of reference
01569                                                          clock cycles equal to the value of pcs_rx_los_mask_val<9:0>. This control filters out
01570                                                          short, non-compliant LFPS glitches sent by a noncompliant host.
01571                                                          For normal operation, set to a targeted mask interval of 10us (value = 10us / Tref_clk).
01572                                                          If the UCTL()_CTL[REF_CLK_DIV2] is used, then
01573                                                          (value = 10us / (2 * Tref_clk)). These equations are based on the SuperSpeed reference
01574                                                          clock frequency. The value of PCS_RX_LOS_MASK_VAL should be as follows:
01575                                                          <pre>
01576                                                               Frequency   DIV2  LOS_MASK
01577                                                               ---------    ---  --------
01578                                                               200   MHz      1     0x3E8
01579                                                               125   MHz      0     0x4E2
01580                                                               104   MHz      0     0x410
01581                                                               100   MHz      0     0x3E8
01582                                                                96   MHz      0     0x3C0
01583                                                                76.8 MHz      1     0x180
01584                                                                52   MHz      0     0x208
01585                                                                50   MHz      0     0x1F4
01586                                                                48   MHz      0     0x1E0
01587                                                                40   MHz      1     0x0C8
01588                                                                38.4 MHz      0     0x180
01589                                                                26   MHz      0     0x104
01590                                                                25   MHz      0     0x0FA
01591                                                                24   MHz      0     0x0F0
01592                                                                20   MHz      0     0x0C8
01593                                                                19.2 MHz      0     0x0C0
01594                                                          </pre>
01595                                                          Setting this bus to 0x0 disables masking. The value should be defined when the PHY is in
01596                                                          reset. Changing this value during operation might disrupt normal operation of the link. */
01597     uint64_t pcs_tx_deemph_3p5db          : 6;  /**< Fine-tune transmitter driver deemphasis when set to 3.5db.
01598                                                          This static value sets the TX driver deemphasis value when
01599                                                          UAHC()_GUSB3PIPECTL()[TXDEEMPHASIS] is set to
01600                                                          0x1 (according to the PIPE3 specification). The values for transmit deemphasis are derived
01601                                                          from the following equation:
01602                                                          _ TX de-emphasis (db) = 20 * log_base_10((128 - 2 * pcs_tx_deemph)/128)
01603                                                          In general, the parameter controls are static signals to be set prior to taking the PHY
01604                                                          out of reset. However, you can dynamically change these values on-the-fly for test
01605                                                          purposes. In this case, changes to the transmitter to reflect the current value occur only
01606                                                          after the UAHC()_GUSB3PIPECTL()[TXDEEMPHASIS] changes. */
01607     uint64_t pcs_tx_deemph_6db            : 6;  /**< Fine-tune transmitter driver deemphasis when set to 6 db.
01608                                                          This static value sets the TX driver deemphasis value when
01609                                                          UAHC()_GUSB3PIPECTL()[TXDEEMPHASIS] is set to
01610                                                          0x2 (according to the PIPE3 specification). This bus is provided for completeness and as a
01611                                                          second potential launch amplitude. The values for transmit deemphasis are derived from the
01612                                                          following equation:
01613                                                          _ TX deemphasis (db) = 20 * log_base_10((128 - 2 * pcs_tx_deemph)/128)
01614                                                          In general, the parameter controls are static signals to be set prior to taking the PHY
01615                                                          out of reset. However, you can dynamically change these values on-the-fly for test
01616                                                          purposes. In this case, changes to the transmitter to reflect the current value occur only
01617                                                          after the UAHC()_GUSB3PIPECTL()[TXDEEMPHASIS] changes. */
01618     uint64_t pcs_tx_swing_full            : 7;  /**< Launch amplitude of the transmitter. Sets the launch amplitude of the transmitter. The
01619                                                          values for transmit amplitude are derived from the following equation:
01620                                                          TX amplitude (V) = vptx * ((pcs_tx_swing_full + 1)/128)
01621                                                          In general, the parameter controls are static signals to be set prior to taking the PHY
01622                                                          out of reset. However, you can dynamically change these values on-the-fly for test
01623                                                          purposes. In this case, changes to the transmitter to reflect the current value occur only
01624                                                          after the UAHC()_GUSB3PIPECTL()[TXDEEMPHASIS] changes. */
01625     uint64_t lane0_tx_term_offset         : 5;  /**< Transmitter termination offset. Reserved, set to 0x0. */
01626     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
01627     uint64_t res_tune_ack                 : 1;  /**< Resistor tune acknowledge. While asserted, indicates a resistor tune is in progress. */
01628     uint64_t res_tune_req                 : 1;  /**< Resistor tune request. The rising edge triggers a resistor tune request (if one is not
01629                                                          already in progress). When asserted, [RES_TUNE_ACK] is asserted high until calibration of
01630                                                          the termination impedance is complete.
01631                                                          Tuning disrupts the normal flow of data; therefore, assert [RES_TUNE_REQ] only when the
01632                                                          PHY
01633                                                          is inactive. The PHY automatically performs a tune when coming out of PRST. */
01634     uint64_t reserved_0_3                 : 4;
01635 #else
01636     uint64_t reserved_0_3                 : 4;
01637     uint64_t res_tune_req                 : 1;
01638     uint64_t res_tune_ack                 : 1;
01639     uint64_t reserved_6_7                 : 2;
01640     uint64_t lane0_tx_term_offset         : 5;
01641     uint64_t pcs_tx_swing_full            : 7;
01642     uint64_t pcs_tx_deemph_6db            : 6;
01643     uint64_t pcs_tx_deemph_3p5db          : 6;
01644     uint64_t pcs_rx_los_mask_val          : 10;
01645     uint64_t reserved_42_55               : 14;
01646     uint64_t lane0_tx2rx_loopbk           : 1;
01647     uint64_t lane0_ext_pclk_req           : 1;
01648     uint64_t los_bias                     : 3;
01649     uint64_t tx_vboost_lvl                : 3;
01650 #endif
01651     } s;
01652     struct cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_ss_s      cn78xx;
01653     struct cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_ss_s      cn78xxp1;
01654 };
01655 typedef union cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_ss cvmx_uctlx_portx_cfg_ss_t;

01686 #endif
01687     } s;

01750 /**
01751  * cvmx_uctl#_shim_cfg
01752  *
01753  * This register allows configuration of various shim (UCTL) features. The fields XS_NCB_OOB_*
01754  * are captured when there are no outstanding OOB errors indicated in INTSTAT and a new OOB error
01755  * arrives. The fields XS_BAD_DMA_* are captured when there are no outstanding DMA errors
01756  * indicated in INTSTAT and a new DMA error arrives.
01757  *
01758  * This register is accessible only when UCTL()_CTL[H_CLK_EN] = 1.
01759  *
01760  * This register can be reset by IOI reset or with UCTL()_CTL[UCTL_RST].
01761  */
01762 union cvmx_uctlx_shim_cfg {
01763     uint64_t u64;
01764     struct cvmx_uctlx_shim_cfg_s {
01765 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01766     uint64_t xs_ncb_oob_wrn               : 1;  /**< Read/write error log for out-of-bound UAHC register access.
01767                                                          0 = read, 1 = write. */
01768     uint64_t reserved_60_62               : 3;
01769     uint64_t xs_ncb_oob_osrc              : 12; /**< SRCID error log for out-of-bound UAHC register access. The IOI outbound SRCID for the OOB
01770                                                          error.
01771                                                          <59:58> = chipID.
01772                                                          <57> = Request source: 0 = core, 1 = IOI-device.
01773                                                          <56:51> = Core/IOI-device number. Note that for IOI devices, <56> is always 0.
01774                                                          <50:48> = SubID. */
01775     uint64_t xm_bad_dma_wrn               : 1;  /**< Read/write error log for bad DMA access from UAHC.
01776                                                          0 = read error log, 1 = write error log. */
01777     uint64_t reserved_44_46               : 3;
01778     uint64_t xm_bad_dma_type              : 4;  /**< ErrType error log for bad DMA access from UAHC. Encodes the type of error encountered
01779                                                          (error largest encoded value has priority). See UCTL_XM_BAD_DMA_TYPE_E. */
01780     uint64_t reserved_14_39               : 26;
01781     uint64_t dma_read_cmd                 : 2;  /**< Selects the IOI read command used by DMA accesses. See UCTL_DMA_READ_CMD_E. */
01782     uint64_t reserved_11_11               : 1;
01783     uint64_t dma_write_cmd                : 1;  /**< Selects the NCB write command used by DMA accesses. See UCTL_DMA_WRITE_CMD_E. */
01784     uint64_t dma_endian_mode              : 2;  /**< Selects the endian format for DMA accesses to the L2C. See UCTL_ENDIAN_MODE_E. */
01785     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
01786     uint64_t csr_endian_mode              : 2;  /**< Selects the endian format for IOI CSR accesses to the UAHC. Note that when UAHC CSRs are
01787                                                          accessed via RSL, they are returned as big-endian. See UCTL_ENDIAN_MODE_E. */
01788 #else
01789     uint64_t csr_endian_mode              : 2;
01790     uint64_t reserved_2_7                 : 6;
01791     uint64_t dma_endian_mode              : 2;
01792     uint64_t dma_write_cmd                : 1;
01793     uint64_t reserved_11_11               : 1;
01794     uint64_t dma_read_cmd                 : 2;
01795     uint64_t reserved_14_39               : 26;
01796     uint64_t xm_bad_dma_type              : 4;
01797     uint64_t reserved_44_46               : 3;
01798     uint64_t xm_bad_dma_wrn               : 1;
01799     uint64_t xs_ncb_oob_osrc              : 12;
01800     uint64_t reserved_60_62               : 3;
01801     uint64_t xs_ncb_oob_wrn               : 1;
01802 #endif
01803     } s;
01804     struct cvmx_uctlx_shim_cfg_s          cn78xx;
01805     struct cvmx_uctlx_shim_cfg_s          cn78xxp1;
01806 };

01850 /**
01851  * cvmx_uctl#_uphy_ctl_status
01852  *
01853  * UPHY_CTL_STATUS = USB PHY Control and Status Reigster
01854  * This register controls the USB PHY test and Bist.
01855  */
01856 union cvmx_uctlx_uphy_ctl_status {
01857     uint64_t u64;
01858     struct cvmx_uctlx_uphy_ctl_status_s {
01859 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01860     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
01861     uint64_t bist_done                    : 1;  /**< PHY BIST DONE.  Asserted at the end of the PHY BIST
01862                                                          sequence. */
01863     uint64_t bist_err                     : 1;  /**< PHY BIST Error.  Valid when BIST_ENB is high.
01864                                                          Indicates an internal error was detected during the
01865                                                          BIST sequence. */
01866     uint64_t hsbist                       : 1;  /**< High-Speed BIST Enable */
01867     uint64_t fsbist                       : 1;  /**< Full-Speed BIST Enable */
01868     uint64_t lsbist                       : 1;  /**< Low-Speed BIST Enable */

01870                                                          to zero. Customers not using USB PHY interface
01871                                                          should do the following:
01872                                                            Provide 3.3V to USB_VDD33 Tie USB_REXT to 3.3V
01873                                                            supply and Set SIDDQ to 1. */
01874     uint64_t vtest_en                     : 1;  /**< Analog Test Pin Enable.
01875                                                          1 = The PHY's ANALOG_TEST pin is enabled for the
01876                                                              input and output of applicable analog test
01877                                                              signals.
01878                                                          0 = The ANALOG_TEST pin is disabled. */
01879     uint64_t uphy_bist                    : 1;  /**< When set to 1,  it makes sure that during PHY BIST,
01880                                                          utmi_txvld == 0. */
01881     uint64_t bist_en                      : 1;  /**< PHY BIST ENABLE */
01882     uint64_t ate_reset                    : 1;  /**< Reset Input from ATE. This is a test signal. When
01883                                                          the USB core is powered up (not in suspend mode), an
01884                                                          automatic tester can use this to disable PHYCLOCK
01885                                                          and FREECLK, then re-enable them with an aligned
01886                                                          phase.
01887                                                          - 1:  PHYCLOCKs and FREECLK outputs are disable.
01888                                                          - 0: PHYCLOCKs and FREECLK are available within a
01889                                                              specific period after ATERESET is de-asserted. */
01890 #else
01891     uint64_t ate_reset                    : 1;
01892     uint64_t bist_en                      : 1;
01893     uint64_t uphy_bist                    : 1;
01894     uint64_t vtest_en                     : 1;
01895     uint64_t siddq                        : 1;
01896     uint64_t lsbist                       : 1;
01897     uint64_t fsbist                       : 1;
01898     uint64_t hsbist                       : 1;
01899     uint64_t bist_err                     : 1;
01900     uint64_t bist_done                    : 1;
01901     uint64_t reserved_10_63               : 54;
01902 #endif
01903     } s;
01904     struct cvmx_uctlx_uphy_ctl_status_s   cn61xx;
01905     struct cvmx_uctlx_uphy_ctl_status_s   cn63xx;

01914 /**
01915  * cvmx_uctl#_uphy_port#_ctl_status

01917  * UPHY_PORTX_CTL_STATUS = USB PHY Port X Control and Status Reigsters
01918  * This register controls the each port of the USB PHY.
01919  */
01920 union cvmx_uctlx_uphy_portx_ctl_status {
01921     uint64_t u64;
01922     struct cvmx_uctlx_uphy_portx_ctl_status_s {
01923 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01924     uint64_t reserved_43_63               : 21;
01925     uint64_t tdata_out                    : 4;  /**< PHY test data out. Presents either interlly
01926                                                          generated signals or test register contenets, based
01927                                                          upon the value of TDATA_SEL */
01928     uint64_t txbiststuffenh               : 1;  /**< High-Byte Transmit Bit-Stuffing Enable. It must be
01929                                                          set to 1'b1 in normal operation. */
01930     uint64_t txbiststuffen                : 1;  /**< Low-Byte Transmit Bit-Stuffing Enable. It must be
01931                                                          set to 1'b1 in normal operation. */
01932     uint64_t dmpulldown                   : 1;  /**< D- Pull-Down Resistor Enable. It must be set to 1'b1
01933                                                          in normal operation. */
01934     uint64_t dppulldown                   : 1;  /**< D+ Pull-Down Resistor Enable. It must be set to 1'b1
01935                                                          in normal operation. */
01936     uint64_t vbusvldext                   : 1;  /**< In host mode, this input is not used and can be tied
01937                                                          to 1'b0. */
01938     uint64_t portreset                    : 1;  /**< Per-port reset */
01939     uint64_t txhsvxtune                   : 2;  /**< Transmitter High-Speed Crossover Adjustment */
01940     uint64_t txvreftune                   : 4;  /**< HS DC Voltage Level Adjustment
01941                                                          When the recommended 37.4 Ohm resistor is present
01942                                                          on USB_REXT, the recommended TXVREFTUNE value is 15 */
01943     uint64_t txrisetune                   : 1;  /**< HS Transmitter Rise/Fall Time Adjustment
01944                                                          When the recommended 37.4 Ohm resistor is present
01945                                                          on USB_REXT, the recommended TXRISETUNE value is 1 */
01946     uint64_t txpreemphasistune            : 1;  /**< HS transmitter pre-emphasis enable.
01947                                                          When the recommended 37.4 Ohm resistor is present
01948                                                          on USB_REXT, the recommended TXPREEMPHASISTUNE
01949                                                          value is 1 */
01950     uint64_t txfslstune                   : 4;  /**< FS/LS Source Impedance Adjustment */
01951     uint64_t sqrxtune                     : 3;  /**< Squelch Threshold Adjustment */
01952     uint64_t compdistune                  : 3;  /**< Disconnect Threshold Adjustment */
01953     uint64_t loop_en                      : 1;  /**< Port Loop back Test Enable
01954                                                          - 1: During data transmission, the receive logic is
01955                                                              enabled
01956                                                          - 0: During data transmission, the receive logic is
01957                                                              disabled */
01958     uint64_t tclk                         : 1;  /**< PHY port test clock, used to load TDATA_IN to the
01959                                                          UPHY. */
01960     uint64_t tdata_sel                    : 1;  /**< Test Data out select
01961                                                          - 1: Mode-defined test register contents are output
01962                                                          - 0: internally generated signals are output */
01963     uint64_t taddr_in                     : 4;  /**< Mode address for test interface. Specifies the
01964                                                          register address for writing to or reading from the
01965                                                          PHY test interface register. */
01966     uint64_t tdata_in                     : 8;  /**< Internal testing Register input data and select.
01967                                                          This is a test bus. Data presents on [3:0] and the
01968                                                          corresponding select (enable) presents on bits[7:4]. */
01969 #else
01970     uint64_t tdata_in                     : 8;
